app.framework

Class Radio<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • app.framework.Radio<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of data to utilize in Consumers.

    public class Radio<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    The Radio class describes an event emitter that can be used for emitting and listening to events.
    See Also:
    https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Event-driven_programming

      • emit

        public final boolean emit(java.lang.String event)
        Emit an event with the specified name.
        Parameters:
        event - The name of the event to emit.
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating whether or not the event was picked up by a Consumer.

      • emit

        public final boolean emit(java.lang.String event,
                          T data)
        Emit an event with the specified name and data.
        Parameters:
        event - The name of the event to emit.
        data - The data to pass on to Consumers.
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating whether or not the event was picked up by a Consumer.

      • on

        public final boolean on(java.lang.String event,
                        java.util.function.Consumer<T> consumer)
        Attach a Consumer to the specified event.
        Parameters:
        event - The name of the event to attach the Consumer to.
        consumer - The Consumer to attach to the specified event.
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating whether or not the operation affected the set of Consumers attached to the specified event.

      • off

        Detach a Consumer from the specified event.
        Parameters:
        event - The name of the event to detach the Consumer from.
        consumer - The Consumer to detach from the specified event.
        Returns:
